text: James Goodfellow (16 September 1943 – 22 April 2020) was an English professional footballer and manager. He played as a midfielder. Goodfellow was born in Bishop Auckland. In the Football League, he played for Port Vale, Workington, Rotherham United and Stockport County. He scored 33 goals in 479 league games in a 13-year career in the Football League. He later managed Cardiff City in 1984. Goodfellow died in Newport, Wales, on 22 April 2020. He was 76. ==Career statistics== ===Playing statistics=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season Division League FA Cup Other Total Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Port Vale 1966–67 Fourth Division 26 7 1 0 1 0 28 7 1967–68 Fourth Division 28 1 1 1 2 0 31 2 1968–69 Fourth Division 31 3 5 0 0 0 36 3 Total 85 10 7 1 3 0 95 11 Workington 1969–70 Fourth Division 46 4 2 1 2 0 50 5 1970–71 Fourth Division 44 1 4 2 2 0 50 3 1971–72 Fourth Division 46 4 2 1 1 0 49 5 1972–73 Fourth Division 44 4 4 2 2 0 50 6 1973–74 Fourth Division 19 2 1 0 0 0 20 2 Total 199 15 10 4 7 0 216 19 Rotherham United 1973–74 Fourth Division 19 3 0 0 0 0 19 3 1974–75 Fourth Division 40 1 4 0 4 0 48 1 1975–76 Third Division 46 2 2 1 2 0 50 2 1976–77 Third Division 42 0 5 0 2 0 49 0 1977–78 Third Division 45 2 4 0 4 0 53 2 Total 192 8 15 1 12 0 119 9 Stockport County 1978–79 Fourth Division 3 0 0 0 2 0 5 0 Career total 479 33 32 6 24 0 535 39 ===Managerial statistics=== Managerial record by team and tenure Team From To Record Record Record Record Record Team From To Cardiff City 1 March 1984 27 September 1984 Total Total Total ==Honours== ;Crook Town *FA Amateur Cup: 1964 ;Rotherham United *Football League Fourth Division third-place promotion: 1974–75 ==References== ;General * ;Specific Category:1943 births Category:2020 deaths Category:English footballers Category:English football managers Category:Sportspeople from County Durham
